results.title: Monkey: eps. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Daisuke Yamazaki, Kokusai Hoei and Nihon Terebi
results.brief_description: Monkey Goes Wild About Heaven: Mischievous Monkey is summoned to Heaven where he steals the heavenly peaches and fights with two of the Emperor’s officials, after which all three are expelled to Earth. Monkey is imprisoned under a mountain, while the other two are transformed into a pig monster and a water monster. “Monkey Turns Nursemaid”: Buddha sends Boddhisattva Huan-yin the Compassionate as messenger to find a holy man to journey from China to India to fetch the large vehicle scriptures. She chooses the boy priest Hsuan Tsang, and bestows upon him the name Tripitaka. “The Great Journey Begins”: Tripitaka and Monkey begin their perilous journey. Along the way they encounter Pigsy and Sandy. Based on the sixteenth century book of the same name by Ch eng-en Wu. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Money mad
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: An old miser is robbed and killed by two thugs, who subsequently kill one another as each tries to get all the loot. Cast includes Charles Inslee, George Gebhardt, Arthur V. Johnson, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: Money in the marketplace
results.creator_credit: Craig Witty and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows the functions of money as a medium of exchange and as a measure of value. Demonstrates that money is divisible, durable and portable. Introduces the concept of barter and discusses the significance of the market place and the relation to the circulation of money. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Money in the bank
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nethercott, Cyril Randall Productions and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: The theories and workings of banking from sub-branches in small villages to great head offices, showing how banks can serve, help and advise everyone in their various pursuits.

results.title: Money for sale: the work of the Sydney Stock Exchange
results.brief_description: Activity at Sydney’s Stock Exchange and ways this activity can affect the man in the street. Includes an investment group meeting to discuss their plans, one of the classes held by the Stock Exchange to explain how the stock market works, and actual buying and selling on the floor of the Exchange. The cameras catch some of the tremendous activity which followed the announcement of the easing of credit restrictions.

results.title: Money-go-round
results.creator_credit: Alvin Rakoff, Margaret K Johns and Liberatas Films
results.brief_description: The work and responsibilities of stockbrokers and jobbers in the financial world are revealed to two teenagers, Peter and Susan, who are suddenly transported from the hurly burly of their local market to what they believe to be a “Champagne and Caviar” wonderland in the Stock Exchange. However they learn that the people involved are ordinary people, and that without a free Stock Exchange turning shares into money and money into shares at tremendous speed, the whole economy of the country would slow down. Featured also is the pop group The Koobas originating from Liverpool, England.

results.title: Monetary towns. No. 3. Kalgoorlie, Western Australia
results.brief_description: Many relics and buildings of the 1893-1895 gold rush period in Western Australia are featured, together with a look at the ghost town of Coolgardie.

results.title: Monarch butterfly story
results.brief_description: Portrays the four stages in the life cycle of the Monarch butterfly. Close-up photography depicts the Monarch laying its eggs, and shows the caterpillar eating its way out of the egg, feeding, moulting, forming its chrysalis, and emerging as a butterfly.

results.title: Momotaro, the peach boy
results.brief_description: Japanese animated puppet version of a fairy story. An old couple find a baby boy in a peach and bring him up as their own son. He becomes the strongest boy in the village, and is able to save some villagers who are kidnapped by demons.

results.title: Momma don't allow
results.creator_credit: Karel Reisz, Tony Richardson and BFI
results.brief_description: One of the ‘Free Cinema’ films produced with the assistance of the British Film Institute Experimental Production Fund, established to encourage the production of films of an experimental or original nature. It was photographed on nine Saturday evenings at Art and Viv Sanders’ ‘Wood Green Jazz Club’ in ‘The Fishmonger’s Arms’. It was shot with the co-operation of the club’s members and was made cheaply on 16mm film with single-track sound transferred from tape recordings. Unhampered by sponsors, the makers of this film have been free to capture and admire the freedom, exuberance and vitality of the Jazz Club. These suburban clubs were run for and by enthusiasts; their atmosphere was not whipped up by promoters but created by the London teenagers who evolved their own free styles of dancing and created their own world of relaxation and enjoyment. Appearing in this film are members of ‘The Chris Barber Band’, Chris Barber, Pat Halcox, Lonnie Donegan, Monty Sunshine, Ron Bowden, Jim Bray and Ottilie Patterson.
